As a nation we are committed to ending the opioid crisis. Our first responders are the tip of the spear in those efforts. The HEROES Act will help local police, fire, & EMTs stay alive as they keep our communities safe.

That’s why I introduced the HEROES Act, so police and first responder units can utilize federal grants to purchase naloxone. https://gibbs.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/gibbs-introduces-legislation-expand-use-naloxone-first-responders …
We are seeing first responders exposed to and experience overdose of illegal narcotics in the line of duty. Expanding availability of naloxone will help save lives.
The census citizenship question is not asking about legal status, only citizenship. It’s the same question the United Nations recommends nations ask in their census. @GOPoversight

The ACS asks respondents about their citizenship status and Democrats didn’t complain. Why are Democrats protesting now? We have the right to know how many citizens and non-citizens are in the US. @GOPoversight

Many nations ask a citizenship question in their census: Australia, Canada, Germany & others. In fact, we even ask it in the American Community Survey. It shouldn’t be controversial to do the same for the 2020 Census @GOPoversight
